positive.review: First RTS game to natively support multi-monitor.

This game was my first experience with an RTS, and it has ruined all other games of the genre for me. I simply cannot imagine RTS games without features this game has. Supreme Commander is very macro oriented, all the while keeping micro elements, i'd say it strikes a very healthy balance between them. Unlike in many other games of the genre, SupCom simulates each projectile properly, and often you can dodge projectiles if they are slow enough. Lasers and homing munitions on the other hand cannot miss, which makes sense since they are designed to always land a hit. However the game heavily relies on intel and offers counters to what your opponent is doing that are usually cheaper to make than whatever the enemy is up to. Having a solid plan/build for the game helps, but towards the end you inevitably will end up not noticing something on the battlefield, simply because of how many things can happen at the same time as the game progresses. For me personally this is more of a frustrating aspect of the game, because if your opponent can run more things than you simultaneously (properly command more units than you at the same time), most likely you are going to lose, no matter how hard you try. Losing in this game is feels pretty devastating, often starting with slight losses at the front leading to total collapse of your operations. I found myself sometimes being unable do anything about it, and you sit there, watching as your empire crumbles, waiting for the inevitable. It's emotional, really.
Factions in game have both similar and unique units, making them have subtle differences that are usually unnoticed if you're just starting to play the game. Before you play, i highly recommend at least playing trough campaign to get an introduction to the basics.
The game itself doesn't have online support anymore, so the community runs servers it instead. Visit faforever.com to play online, they offer a free game client as well as regular balancing updates for the game.
Overall, i have not seen anything come close to strategy genre masterpiece as this has. Try it out, the game often goes on 90% sale for literal cents.

Best massive RTS, unfortunately, often crashes in Windows 11.

Pros :
+ Good new unit with multi-role purpose 

Cons :
+ Only 6 missions, and you repeat those same 6 maps with 3 different faction.
+ Hence, shouldn't cost as much as the base game.


Tips to reduce crash :
+ Run Compatibility mode to Windows XP (create shortcut then modify it's property)
   - Disable Fullscreen Optimizations
   - Run this program as administrator
   - Use Legacy DIsplay ICC Management
+ Play offline
+ Do not turn on any overlay

Any RTS enjoyer who has played this game will likely tell you it's the best of what the genre has to offer of any game like it. Gameplay is very polished, and many have tried to clone the exact style of game since but none can compete in terms of balancing and pacing. Highly recommend the fan-made Forged Alliance Forever launcher which is where you'll find nearly all of the dedicated and currently active players while also having access to the plenty user-submitted custom maps and modsüêµüëçüèø
Still has very few RTS games that can even match it. (probably bc they all took inspiration from this game.)
Honestly a pretty fun RTS game, would recommend to large friend groups so that way you can experience the best this game has to offer.
With nearly a thousand hours of game play i can confidently say this game is fantastic well passed its release. and here's hoping for a Supreme Commander 3 in the near future

The game is now old enough to vote and it is still one of the best RTS games ever made and still worth buying. The online scene is very active and the game does not even feel that old when you play it
Old but gold as hell, nothing beats this game when it comes to lagging my pc no matter how good it is.

A gem soon to be 15 years old. Surprisingly simple, yet complex. One of the best mid-age rts games and better than many new modern rts games.

The scale of this game is immense. You have artillery that measures it's range in kilometers, and maps exist that are 20x20. Things can get crazy. Though the game seems to be vehicles and no infantry, nothing is as satisfying as the chunkage caused by combat, especially with the endgame experimental units.

Resource managing is confusing, until you look up how adjacency bonuses work. I recommend a guide if you want some help.

gg
indeed this game is a straight stratigist dream the clear flowing active economy and the sheer amount of units is great along with the varying amounts of maps can create some banger momments
They don't really make RTS like this anymore. Game is fantastic. One of the best RTS experiences I've ever had. Upset that I didn't discover this gem earlier.
Classic Total Annihilation Gameplay. I enjoy the solo, but did not yet play multiplayer.
i only have 367 hours cuz this is my childhood game lol never really played online or with friends
Solid "throwback" RTS. The modding community keeps it going.
SupCom is the greatest RTS ever created.
great game to work the mind
As an RTS its 1 of the best but has a habit of crashing after you end the game play!

this game is more than 15 years old and still one of the greatest 3d RTS games. Back when THQ is still alive and the RTS genre starts to decline with the rise mobile phones and casual gaming and this game could allow you to control hundreds/thousands of units in 3d without much frames issues and you could still find a huge community with FAF if needed.

Literally everything that was good about the original supreme commander was taken, and made better in this standalone expansions, better performance, new maps, new units, and a massive modding and multiplayer ecosystem through the FAF (Forged Alliance Forever) client. Highly recommend if you enjoyed the original supreme commander or if you enjoy games like planetary annihilation, total annihilation, etc.
Still has very few RTS games that can even match it. (probably bc they all took inspiration from this game.)
shits busted i fought somone, nay i struggled against somone who brought to bear an endgame unit the 3 times the size of my commander at the five minute mark of the game.

Yes, a very old title but still one of the best of the classics. Supreme Commander 2, in my opinion, did fall short in comparison to what I would expect for a new version due to graphics and game play type are somewhat the same, so SCfa is by far the best that is out there even though it is very old. I find myself playing SCfa more than SC2 due to the similarities but this is just how I see the two.

negative.review: Did not complete the first campaign mission. Did not try multiplayer. Great game, but my issue was comparing it to the first one.
There's better RTS that allow you to cancel upgrades. Not worth the brainpower to explain more about this game and why it has a downed thumb.

Sound does not work on modern PCs unfortunately. 
Greatest RTS of all time in my own humble opinion. I wish I could hear the top tier soundtrack and SFX once again.

Can't get past the tutorial. Getting stuck when I am supposed to build a radar station in the tutorial, but the schematic is not downloaded to my unit, so I can't build it. Poor tutorial design or plain buggy software?  
Also annoying that i have to scroll the world map with the arrow keys instead of with the mouse as expected. Not configurable, not even step length when pressing arrow keys. I will move on to some other game.
Did not complete the first campaign mission. Did not try multiplayer. Great game, but my issue was comparing it to the first one.
There's better RTS that allow you to cancel upgrades. Not worth the brainpower to explain more about this game and why it has a downed thumb.

Sound does not work on modern PCs unfortunately. 
Greatest RTS of all time in my own humble opinion. I wish I could hear the top tier soundtrack and SFX once again.

Won't run on my Win 11 box. AMD Ryzen 7 5800X, 64GB RAM, Nvidia RTX 3800 12GB. Tried compatibility mode on/off. Tried every resolution from 1024x768x60 up to 2560x1440 at various FPS. Tried full screen and windowed. Nothing worked.  Really hoping they give me my money back.
Great game, loves to crash
